column4: what kernel package is the best for turion64 32 bit kernel? 686 or k7 or k8 or ????
well, 64bit support for apps with a 64 bit kernel is not what i would call stable quite yet, so i would stick with 686 probably
so both of k7 and k8 are for 64 bit? I am running a 32 bit kernel (regular Ubuntu, not AMD64 UBuntu) only
no, k7 is still 32 bit, and k8 iirc is also 32bit...  but it is a safe bet to go with 686 compiled packages for any modern chip
